freenet.support
Class FileLoggerHook

java.lang.Object
  freenet.support.Logger
      freenet.support.LoggerHook
          freenet.support.FileLoggerHook
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class FileLoggerHook
extends LoggerHook
implements Closeable

Converted the old StandardLogger to Ian's loggerhook interface.

Author:
oskar

Constructor Detail

FileLoggerHook

public FileLoggerHook(String filename,
                      String fmt,
                      String dfmt,
                      int threshold,
                      boolean assumeWorking,
                      boolean logOverwrite,
                      long maxOldLogfilesDiskUsage)
               throws IOException
Create a Logger to append to the given file. If the file does not exist it will be created.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file to log to.
fmt - log message format string
dfmt - date format string
threshold - Lowest logged priority
assumeWorking - If false, check whether stderr and stdout are writable and if not, redirect them to the log file
Throws:
IOException - if the file couldn't be opened for append.

fmt - log message format string

threshold - Lowest logged priority

getHourLogName

protected String getHourLogName(Calendar c,
                                int digit,
                                boolean compressed)
The extra parameter int digit is to be used for creating a logfile name when a log exists already with the same date.

Parameters:
c -
digit - log file name suffix. ignored if this is < 0
compressed -
Returns:

Description copied from class: LoggerHook
Log a message

Specified by:
log in class LoggerHook
Parameters:
o - The object where this message was generated.
c - The class where this message was generated.
msg - A clear and verbose message describing the event
e - Logs this exception with the message.
priority - The priority of the mesage, one of Logger.ERROR, Logger.NORMAL, Logger.MINOR, or Logger.DEBUG.

setMaxOldLogsSize

public void setMaxOldLogsSize(long val)
Set the maximum size of old (gzipped) log files to keep. Will start to prune old files immediately, but this will likely not be completed by the time the function returns as it is run off-thread.

hasRedirectedStdOutErrNoLock

public boolean hasRedirectedStdOutErrNoLock()
This is used by the lost-lock deadlock detector so MUST NOT TAKE A LOCK ever!
